org.daisy.streamline.api.config

Interface ConfigurationsCatalogService

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConfigurationsCatalog

    public interface ConfigurationsCatalogService

    Provides an interface for a ConfigurationsCatalog service. The purpose of this interface is to expose an implementation of a ConfigurationsCatalog as an OSGi service.

    To comply with this interface, an implementation must be thread safe and address both the possibility that only a single instance is created and used throughout and that new instances are created as desired.

      Returns configuration properties associated with the identifier.
      java.util.Set<ConfigurationDetails> getConfigurationDetails()
      Gets all configuration details available to the configurations catalog.
      boolean isRemovable(java.lang.String identifier)
      Returns true if the configuration with the specified identifier can be removed.
      boolean removeConfiguration(java.lang.String identifier)
      Removes the configuration with the specified identifier.
      boolean supportsUserConfigurations()
      Returns true if user configurations are supported, false otherwise.

    • Method Detail

      • getConfigurationDetails

        java.util.Set<ConfigurationDetails> getConfigurationDetails()
        Gets all configuration details available to the configurations catalog.
        Returns:
        returns a set of configuration details.

      • getConfiguration

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getConfiguration(java.lang.String identifier)
                                                           throws ConfigurationsProviderException
        Returns configuration properties associated with the identifier.
        Parameters:
        identifier - the configuration key
        Returns:
        returns properties for the configuration
        Throws:
        ConfigurationsProviderException - if identifier is unknown.

      • supportsUserConfigurations

        boolean supportsUserConfigurations()
        Returns true if user configurations are supported, false otherwise. If this method returns false, addConfiguration(String, String, Map), isRemovable(String), removeConfiguration(String) should not be used.
        Returns:
        true if user configurations are supported, false otherwise

      • addConfiguration

        boolean addConfiguration(java.lang.String niceName,
                         java.lang.String description,
                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> config)
        Adds a configuration to this catalog.
        Parameters:
        niceName - the display name
        description - the configuration description
        config - the configuration details
        Returns:
        true if the configuration was successfully added, false otherwise

      • isRemovable

        boolean isRemovable(java.lang.String identifier)
        Returns true if the configuration with the specified identifier can be removed.
        Parameters:
        identifier - the identifier
        Returns:
        true if the configuration can be removed, false otherwise

      • removeConfiguration

        boolean removeConfiguration(java.lang.String identifier)
        Removes the configuration with the specified identifier.
        Parameters:
        identifier - the identifier
        Returns:
        true if the configuration was successfully removed, false otherwise
